title: Package Management
description: CIS Ubuntu Linux 24.04 LTS Benchmark - Section 1.2: Package Management

controls.title: Ensure GPG keys are configured
controls.description: Most package managers implement GPG key signing to verify package integrity during installation.
controls.impact: It is important to ensure that updates are obtained from a valid source to protect against spoofing that could lead to the inadvertent installation of malware on the system.
controls.remediation: Update your package manager GPG keys in accordance with site policy.
controls.expected: GPG keys properly configured for package repositories

controls.title: Ensure package manager repositories are configured
controls.description: Systems need to have package manager repositories configured to ensure they receive the latest patches and updates.
controls.impact: If a system's package repositories are misconfigured important patches may not be identified or a rogue repository could introduce compromised software.
controls.remediation: Configure your package manager repositories according to site policy.

controls.title: Ensure updates, patches, and additional security software are installed
controls.description: Periodically patches are released for included software either due to security flaws or to include additional functionality.
controls.impact: Newer patches may contain security enhancements that would not be available through the latest full update. As a result, it is recommended that the latest software patches be used to take advantage of the latest functionality.
controls.remediation: Use your package manager to update all packages on the system according to site policy.
controls.expected: System packages are up to date
